inference:
1) The area of a triangle is given by 
$$Area = \frac{1}{2} \times base \times height.$$
2) In this case, the base is $AB = 25 \mbox{ cm}$ and the height is $AC = 20 \mbox{ cm}$.
3) Substituting these values into the formula, we get
$$Area = \frac{1}{2} \times 25 \mbox{ cm} \times 20 \mbox{ cm} = 250 \mbox{ cm}^2$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{250 \mbox{ cm}^2}$. I hope it is correct.
